name: Monthly Extend AI column and WBS tags_v2

source:
import pandas as pd
import pyspark.pandas as ps
import json
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import calendar
import warnings

import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T

def load_source_files(path, subscription_path, appListPath):
    
    print(f'Loading Cost file list - {path}')
    cost_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(path)
    print(f"Cost file contains: {cost_df.count()} rows")
    
    print(f'Loading Subscription list - {subscription_path}...')
    subscription_list = spark.read.json(subscription_path)
    print(f"Subscription file contains: {subscription_list.count()} rows")

    print(f'Loading SNOW application list - {appListPath}...')
    appList = spark.read.format('parquet').load(appListPath)
    appList = appList.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast("int"))

    print(f'App list contains: {appList.count()}')

    return cost_df, subscription_list, appList

def populate_columns(cost_df):

    # Populating the Azure Hybrid Benefit Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Azure_Hybrid_Benefit', F.when(F.col('MeterSubCategory').contains('Windows'), "Not Enabled")\
                                                         .when(F.col('ServiceInfo2') == 'Windows Server BYOL', "Enabled")\
                                                         .otherwise('Not Supported'))

    # Populating the isRIUsage Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('IsRIUsage',
                                 F.when(F.col('ReservationId').isNull(), 'On Demand Usage')\
                                  .otherwise('RI Usage'))

    return cost_df

def extend_additional_info(cost_df):
    # Extend AdditionalInfo Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AdditionalInfo', F.from_json('AdditionalInfo', 'map<string,string>', options={'inferSchema': 'true'}))

    # Creating an ID column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('id', F.monotonically_increasing_id())

    # Creating a list of columns we want to keep
    cols_to_keep = ["UsageType", 
                    "ImageType",
                    "ServiceType",
                    "VMName",
                    "VMApplicationName",
                    "VMProperties",
                    "VCPUs",
                    "AHB",
                    "vCores",
                    "RINormalizationRatio",
                    "ConsumedQuantity",
                    "DatabaseName"]

    for col in cols_to_keep:
        cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_' + col, F.coalesce(F.col(f'AdditionalInfo.{col}'), F.lit(None)))
    print(cost_df.columns)
    return cost_df

def AHB_column(cost_df):

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_VCPUs', F.col('ai_VCPUs').cast('int'))
    cost_df = cost_df.na.fill({'ai_VCPUs' : 0})
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AHB_CPUs', F.when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 0, 0)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') < 8, 8)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') < 16, 16)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 20, 24)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') > 20, F.col('ai_VCPUs'))\
                                              .otherwise(0))

    return cost_df

def instance_name(cost_df):

    # cost_df = cost_df.withColumnRenamed('ai_VMName', 'ai_Container_VMName')

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Instance_Name', F.when(F.col('ai_VMName').isNull(), F.col('ResourceName'))\
                                                   .when(F.col('ai_VMName').isNotNull(), F.col('ai_VMName'))\
                                                   .otherwise(0))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('UnitPrice', F.col('UnitPrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('PayGPrice', F.col('PayGPrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('Quantity', F.col('Quantity').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('EffectivePrice', F.col('EffectivePrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('CostInBillingCurrency', F.col('CostInBillingCurrency').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('Date', F.to_date(F.col('Date'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))\
                     .withColumn('BillingPeriodStartDate', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriodStartDate'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))\
                     .withColumn('BillingPeriodEndDate', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriodEndDate'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))

    return cost_df

def expand_subscription_tags(subscription_list):
        
    subscription_list = subscription_list.withColumnRenamed('id', 'SubId')
    subscription_list = subscription_list.withColumn('id', F.monotonically_increasing_id())

    try:
        subscription_list = subscription_list.withColumn('tags', F.from_json(F.col('tags')))
    except:
        print('Already a json file')

    # Expanding the tags list into separate columns
    subscription_list = subscription_list.withColumn('SubscriptionWBS', F.col('tags.WBS'))
    subscription_list = subscription_list.withColumn('SubscriptionServiceNow-App', F.col('tags.ServiceNow-App'))
    subscription_list = subscription_list.drop('tags')

    # Dropping unnecessary columns and setting the schema
    columns_to_keep = ['SubId', 'SubscriptionWBS', 'SubscriptionServiceNow-App']
    subscription_list = subscription_list.select(columns_to_keep)

    

    return subscription_list

def merge_dataframes(cost_df, subscription_list):
    
    cost_df = cost_df.join(subscription_list, cost_df.SubscriptionId == subscription_list.SubId, how='left')
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('SubId')

    return cost_df, subscription_list

def expand_cost_tags(cost_df):
    
    # Storing the Tags column in a new column, and cleaning it up to fit with CostAllocationType
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.regexp_extract(F.col('Tags'), 'CostAllocationType": "(.*)"', 0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.regexp_replace(F.col('CostAllocationType'), 'CostAllocationType": "', ""))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.split(F.col('CostAllocationType'),'"', 0).getItem(0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == "", None).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))

    # Storing the Tags column in a new column, and cleaning it up to fit with CostAllocationCode
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.regexp_extract(F.col('Tags'), 'CostAllocationCode": "(.*)"', 0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.regexp_replace(F.col('CostAllocationCode'), 'CostAllocationCode": "', ""))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.split(F.col('CostAllocationCode'),'"', 0).getItem(0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationCode') == "", None).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    
    print("Cost Tags expansion complete")

    return cost_df

def replace_empty_cost_fields_with_subscription_details(cost_df, appList):
    print("Creating ActiveWBS column, copying over CostAllocationCode, replacing 'TOBESPECIFIED' and empty values then filling gaps with SubscriptionWBS...")

    # Apply Upper-case for all CostAllocationTypes and Codes
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))

    # When the tag does not contain CostAllocationCode or CostAllocationType, then we fill/replace the value in ActiveWBSReason
    mask1 = F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull() | F.col('CostAllocationType').isNull()
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(mask1, F.lit('CostAllocationType or CostAllocationCode not present in Tags')))

    # When either value in mask appears in AcitveWBS, add invalid reason in new column
    mask2 = ['WBS', 'APPID', 'CI', 'SubscriptionWBS'] # where is SubscriptionWBS? 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(~F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(mask2), F.lit('Invalid CostAllocationType: not APPID, CI or WBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    # When the values in the columns below match the mask and the cost type is WBS, then:
    # regex pattern states that the string should start with a case insensitive letter, followed by a dot, followed by either letters, numbers or dots
    pattern = r'^[a-zA-Z]\.[a-zA-Z0-9.]+$'
    rmask = F.col('CostAllocationCode').rlike(pattern)
    cost_wbs = (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'WBS')

    # Applying valid WBS' as Active WBS'
    # 1. Where the CostAllocationCode follows the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, we apply the CostAllocationCode
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(cost_wbs & rmask, F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    # 2. Where the CostAllocationCode doesn't follow the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, we set the ActiveWBSReason to be "Invalid CostAllocationCode WBS"
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(cost_wbs & ~rmask, F.lit('Invalid CostAllocationCode WBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    # 3. Where the CostAllocationCode doesn't follow the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, the CostAllocationType is changed to "SubscriptionWBS"
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(cost_wbs & ~rmask, F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))

    # Applying valid AppIDs as Active WBS'
    # If the CostAllocationCode is empty, we fill/replace the column ActiveWBS with Operational WBS in the AppList
    map_app = appList.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('AppID', 'OperationalWBS')
    joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.AppID, how='left')
    cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('OperationalWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('OperationalWBS')

    # Applying valid CIs as Active WBS'
    # Same here as above, but we merge the dataframes on ApplicationNames rather than AppID
    #map_app = appList.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS') # Remove withColumn
    map_app = appList.select('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS') # Remove withColumn
    # Apply join with case insensitivity
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode_upper',F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))
    joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app.ApplicationName_upper, how='left').drop('CostAllocationCode_upper','ApplicationName_upper')
    cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('OperationalWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    
    #cost_df = cost_df.drop('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS', 'AppID')
    # Alternative 1 remove "AppID" 
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS')

    # When ActiveWBS value is string 'TOBESPECIFIED', we replace the value with None. # Why this ActiveWBS have TOBSPECIFIED value? 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.upper(F.col('ActiveWBS')) == 'TOBESPECIFIED', F.lit(None)).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))

    # When Subscriptions are not attached to the costs (unassigned), we fill the values with Unassigned and state the ActiveWBSReason.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned Subscription, possibly unused RI/SP')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    # Now that we have filled in most places in ActiveWBS, if the rest of ActiveWBS is Null, then we apply the CostCenter WBS
    # When CostAllocationType is null, we fill it with the value from SubscriptionWBS
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID'), F.lit('AppID CostAllocationCode Invalid or Missing')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI'), F.lit('CI CostAllocationCode Invalid or Missing')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('CostCenter')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS'))) # Cost Center is identical to SubscriptionWBS. So we can remove subscription.json.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(~F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(mask2), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType').isNull(), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType'))) #  Can be removed.

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBSReason').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'SubscriptionWBS'), F.lit('No valid AppID, WBS or CI')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    

    # When CostAllocationType is a specific string, we fill/replace the value in ActiveWBSReason 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI', F.lit('CI WBS Lookup from SNOW')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID', F.lit('AppID WBS Lookup from SNOW')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'WBS', F.lit('WBS Cost Tag used')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.upper(F.col('ActiveWBS')))

    # For cases that where CostAllocationCode is empty, we will use AppID from SerivceNow and Application from Subscription.json to replace.
    mask3 = (F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationType')).isin(['APPID']) & F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull())
    mask4 = (F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationType')).isin(['CI']) & F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull())
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.when(mask3, F.col('AppID')) \
                                                       .when(mask4, F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')) \
                                                       .otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationCode'))).drop('AppID')

    return cost_df

# Comment out the code for future use.
    
    # When AppID is present, we use the application name from the Service-Now Application list
    # First convert u_number to a string, then select the desired columns
   #map_app = appList.withColumn('u_number', F.col('u_number').cast(T.StringType())).select('u_number', 'name')
    # Merge the two lists together with a left-join
    #joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.u_number, how='left')
    # Select the application name from AppList when AppID is present in the CostAllocationType, then drop the columns from AppList
    #cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ApplicationName', F.when(appid_mask, F.col('name'))).drop('u_number')

    # When Cost AllocationType is CI, we apply the A as Application Name
    # When neither CI or AppID is present in CostAllocationType, we use the Application Name from the subscription list
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ApplicationName', F.when(ci_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(), F.col('CostAllocationCode'))\
                                                     #.when(ci_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(), F.col('name'))\
                                                     #.when(~ci_mask & ~appid_mask, F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
                                                     #.otherwise(F.col('ApplicationName'))).drop('name')


# name-> ApplicationName
# ApplicationName->Application_Name

def get_application_names(cost_df, appList):
    # For Validation purpose and add codes for testing CostAllocationCode and CostAllocationType typo.
    # Scenairo 1: CostAllocationType is APPID and CostAllocation is PETRAL
    # Scenairo 2: CostAllocationType is CI and CostAllocation is 90009

    # Select the first row for testing
    #test_row = cost_df.limit(1)

    # Update values in the CostAllocationType and CostAllocationCode
    #test_row = test_row.withColumn('CostAllocationType',F.lit("APPID"))
    #test_row = test_row.withColumn('CostAllocationCode',F.lit("PETRAL"))
    #test_row = test_row.withColumn('CostAllocationType',F.lit("CI"))
    #test_row = test_row.withColumn('CostAllocationCode',F.lit("90009"))
    #test_row = test_row.withColumn('CostAllocationCode',F.lit(90009))

    # Create a new DataFrame with the updated row and union it with the Cost_df
    #cost_df = cost_df.union(test_row)

    # Masks for CI and AppID
    ci_mask = F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI'
    appid_mask = F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID'

    # When AppID is present, we use the application name from the Service-Now Application list
    # First convert AppID to a string, then select the desired columns
    map_app = appList.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('AppID', 'ApplicationName')
    
    # Apply case insensitivity merge by creating upper case columns
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode_upper',F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))

    # Conduct the merge between Azure cost file and ServiceNow data based on CostAllocationCode and APPID or ApplicationName.
    condition1= (cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app.AppID)& (cost_df.CostAllocationType == 'APPID')
    condition2= (cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app.ApplicationName)& (cost_df.CostAllocationType == 'CI')
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app,(condition1 | condition2),how='left').drop('CostAllocationCode_upper','ApplicationName_upper') 

    # Create Application_Name column based on Application from ServiceNow to start with.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.col('ApplicationName'))

    # Resolve CostAllocationCode and CostAllocationType typo by replacing Application_name with SubscriptionServiceNow-App value 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
                                                    .when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')).otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))
  
    print('For those empty ApplicationNames will be replaced by SubscriptionServiceNowApp (Applications from Subscription.json) when CostAllocationTypes are SubscriptionWBS and WBS')
    # For those empty ApplicationNames will be replaced by SubscriptionServiceNowApp (Applications from Subscription.json) when CostAllocationTypes are SubscriptionWBS and WBS
    # We need two otherwise in the code to avoid any Null/empty value return to Applciation_Name column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == "SubscriptionWBS") | (F.col('CostAllocationType') == "WBS"),
                                                    F.when(F.col('Application_Name').isNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')).otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))\
                                                    .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    ## Title : Assign Applications that do not have AppID with AppID from ServiceNow by looking up the applications in ServiceNow.
    print("Create upper case column for merge purpose.")
    # Create upper case column for merge purpose.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name_upper',F.upper(F.col('Application_Name')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ServiceNowApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName'))).drop('ApplicationName','ApplicationName_upper')
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ServiceNowAppID',F.col('AppID')).drop('AppID')

    print('Lookup application in ServiceNow')
    # Lookup application in ServiceNow. Those applications that can be found will be merged.
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app,cost_df.Application_Name_upper==map_app.ServiceNowApplicationName_upper,how='left')

    print('Fill empty AppID with AppID from ServiceNow')
    # Fill empty AppID with AppID from ServiceNow
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AppID',F.when(F.col('AppID').isNull(),F.col('ServiceNowAppID'))\
                                          .otherwise(F.col('AppID')))

    print('remove unused Columns')
    # Remove unused Columns
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('Application_Name_upper','ApplicationName','ServiceNowAppID','ServiceNowApplicationName_upper')

    print('Application Name is not found when SubscriptionServiceNow-App is equal to Application_name and AppID is empty')
    # Application Name will be "Application not defined or not found" when SubscriptionServiceNow-App is equal to Application_name as well as AppID is empty.
    # This indicates that application from subscription.json file can not be found in ServiceNow. One of Application example is DATAHUB - MARKETING AND SUPPLY, not found in ServiceNow.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when((F.upper(F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))==F.upper(F.col('Application_Name'))) & (F.col('AppID').isNull()),F.lit('Application not defined or not found'))\
                                           .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))
    print('For anything that left ApplicationName will be "Application not defined or not found".')
    
    # For anything that left ApplicationName will be "Application not defined or not found".
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when(F.col('Application_Name').isNull(),F.lit('Application not defined or not found'))\
                                                     .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))
    # For anything that left AppID will be 0.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AppID',F.when(F.col('AppID').isNull(),F.lit(0))\
                                                     .otherwise(F.col('AppID')))
    
    # Display the final result'
    print('Display the final result')
    display(cost_df)

    # Those codes are used for the future.
    #display(cost_df.filter(cost_df.CostAllocationCode == "PETRAL"))
    #display(cost_df.filter(cost_df.CostAllocationCode == "90009"))
    #display(cost_df.filter(cost_df.CostAllocationCode == 90009))
    #display(cost_df.filter(cost_df.Application_Name == "BIZTALK360"))
    return cost_df

# Those codes may be used in the future.
    # Old Code
    #print('---Testing App join:')
    #print('-map app:')
    #display(map_app)
    #print('-joined df:')
    #display(joined_df)
        # Merge the two lists together with a left-join

    #joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.AppID, how='left')
    # From Joakim cost_df.withColumn('ApplicationName',
    #cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.when(ci_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(), F.col('CostAllocationCode'))\
    #                                        .when(ci_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(), F.col('ApplicationName'))
    #                                        .otherwise(F.col('ApplicationName'))).drop('ApplicationName')
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ProductOwner', F.when(~ci_mask & ~appid_mask, 'Not Found in ServiceNow'))

    # Alternative 2
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',.when(~ci_mask & ~appid_mask, 'Not Found in ServiceNow')\
                                                   # .otherwise(F.column('ApplicationName')).drop('ApplicationName')
    # Select the application name from AppList when AppID is present in the CostAllocationType and remain AppID as key in PBI visualization.
    # We may need to set ApplicationName from ServiceNow as reference. If we find ApplicationName is unlike what Amortized Cost data provides, what should we do? 
    # Old code cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.when(appid_mask, F.col('ApplicationName')))#.drop('AppID')
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when(~ci_mask & ~appid_mask, F.lit("Application not defined or not found"))\
                                                     #.otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.upper(F.col('Application_Name')))
        #display(cost_df.filter(cost_df.CostAllocationCode == "PETRAL"))
    # To Resolve typo error for CostAllocationCode and CostAllocationType in case of CostAllocationType is CI but CostAllocationCode is APPID and vice versa.
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').rlike("[a-zA-Z]"),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
    #                                                 .when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').rlike('[^0-9]'),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')).otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))
        

    # When Cost AllocationType is AppID, we apply the CostAllocationCode as Application Name
    # When neither CI or AppID is present in CostAllocationType, we use the Application Name from the subscription list
    #cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.when(appid_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(), F.col('ApplicationName'))\
    #                                                 .when(appid_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(), F.col('CostAllocationCode'))\
    #                                                 .otherwise(F.col('ApplicationName')))

    # When Cost AllocationType is CI, we apply the CostAllocationCode as Application Name
    # When neither CI or AppID is present in CostAllocationType, we use the Application Name from the subscription list
    #cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.when(ci_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(), F.col('CostAllocationCode'))\
    #                                                 .when(ci_mask & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(), F.col('ApplicationName'))\
    #                                                 .otherwise(F.col('ApplicationName'))).drop('ApplicationName')

def expand_ai_column(cost_df):

    warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)

    # actualCostSourcefilename = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/' + actualCostPath + dateRange + '/ACMMonthlyActualCost_' + dateRange + '.parquet'
    # amortizedCostSourcefilename = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/' + amortizedCostPath + '/' + dateRange + '/ACMMonthlyActualCost_' + dateRange + '.parquet'

    # actualCostDestinationfilename = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/' + actualCostPath + dateRange + '/Extended_ACMMonthlyActualCost_' + dateRange + '.parquet'
    # amortizedCostDestinationfilename = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/' + amortizedCostPath + '/' + dateRange + '/Extended_ACMMonthlyActualCost_' + dateRange + '.parquet'

    # cost_df = load_source(actualCostSourcefilename)
    cost_df = populate_columns(cost_df)
    cost_df = extend_additional_info(cost_df)
    cost_df = AHB_column(cost_df)
    cost_df = instance_name(cost_df)
    
    return cost_df

def populate_wbs_columns(cost_df, subscription_list, appList):

    cost_df = expand_cost_tags(cost_df)
    subscription_list = expand_subscription_tags(subscription_list)
    cost_df, subscription_list = merge_dataframes(cost_df, subscription_list)
    cost_df = replace_empty_cost_fields_with_subscription_details(cost_df, appList)

    print('WBS population complete. Populating application names')

    cost_df = get_application_names(cost_df, appList)
    
    print('App-name population complete')

    return cost_df

def write_output_file(cost_df, destinationFilename):

    # Dropping some columns before writing the output
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('id', 'AdditionalInfo')
    
    print(f'Writing output file to: "{destinationFilename}"')
    print(f'Dataframe length is: {cost_df.count()}')

    # Writing the df to the destination path
    cost_df.write.format('parquet').mode('overwrite').option('path', destinationFilename).save() # df.coalesce(1) if partition should be 1

    print('File write complete!')

print(f'fromDate: {fromDate}')
print(f'toDate: {toDate}')
reportTypes = ['ActualCost', 'AmortizedCost']
#reportTypes = ['AmortizedCost']
year = toDate[:4]
month = toDate[4:6]
day = toDate[6:]

print(f"------ From: {fromDate}, To: {toDate} -----------")

for reportType in reportTypes:

    print(f"------ {reportType} -----------")

    sourceCostPath = 'exports/monthly/ACMMonthly' + reportType + '/'

    longToDate = f'{toDate[0:4]}-{toDate[4:6]}-{toDate[6:]}'
    print(f'longToDate: {longToDate}')
    dateRange = fromDate + '-' + toDate
    print(f'dateRange: {dateRange}')

    print(dateRange)
    costSourcefilename = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/' + sourceCostPath + dateRange + '/ACMMonthly' + reportType + '_' + dateRange + '.parquet'
    costDestinationfilename = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/' + sourceCostPath + dateRange + '/Extended_v2_ACMMonthly' + reportType + '_' + dateRange + '.parquet'
    if str(longToDate) < '2021-11-30':
        print(longToDate)
        print(f'Using default 2021-11-30 subscription json file')
        subscriptionListPath = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/subscriptions/subscriptions_2021-11-30.json'
    else:
        print(f'Using {longToDate} subscription json file')
        subscriptionListPath = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/subscriptions/subscriptions_' + longToDate + '.json'
    appListPath = 'abfss://' + container + '@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/applications/ServiceNow-Application-List-Extended.parquet'

    cost_df, subscription_list, appList = load_source_files(costSourcefilename, subscriptionListPath, appListPath)
    cost_df = expand_ai_column(cost_df)
    cost_df = populate_wbs_columns(cost_df, subscription_list, appList)
    write_output_file(cost_df, costDestinationfilename)
    print(' ')
